intro: Dimorphotheca cuneata, commonly known as the yellow ox-eye daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow ray flowers and dark brown disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Dimorphotheca cuneata is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
